1. Reporting: The first step is to report any alleged harassment or discrimination to the appropriate authority within your organization or educational institution. In this case, it could be a supervisor, human resources department, or Title IX coordinator for an educational institution.

7. Support: Throughout the entire process, both the complainant and respondent should be provided with appropriate resources and support. 8. Retaliation: It is against the law for any individual to retaliate against someone who has reported harassment or discrimination, or who has participated in an investigation process. By following these steps, organizations and educational institutions can effectively address and resolve incidents of harassment or discrimination in accordance with Title IX Implementation in Kansas.
